title: Lawsuit alleges defect on ‘all’ Fitbit smartwatches can cause burns, says refunds are ‘suppressed’
content:
Earlier this year Fitbit issued a recall on its original smartwatch, the Ionic, over reports of the watch causing skin burns for some owners. Now, a lawsuit is alleging that all Fitbit products are affected by the same defect, which could lead to skin burns.

more…

The post Lawsuit alleges defect on ‘all’ Fitbit smartwatches can cause burns, says refunds are ‘suppressed’ appeared first on 9to5Google.
description: A class-action lawsuit alleges that 'all' Fitbit smartwatches have a defect that can cause skin burns, citing examples from several users.
